metadata.Title: CVE-2019-15902 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
A backporting error was discovered in the Linux stable/longterm kernel4.4.x through 4.4.190, 4.9.x through 4.9.190, 4.14.x through 4.14.141,4.19.x through 4.19.69, and 5.2.x through 5.2.11. Misuse of the upstream"x86/ptrace: Fix possible spectre-v1 in ptrace_get_debugreg()" commitreintroduced the Spectre vulnerability that it aimed to eliminate. Thisoccurred because the backport process depends on cherry picking specificcommits, and because two (correctly ordered) code lines were swapped.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-15902` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-9-generic - 5.4.0-9.12
linux-image-5.4.0-9-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-9.12
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-9-generic - 5.4.0-9.12
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-9-lowlatency - 5.4.0-9.12
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-9-snapdragon - 5.4.0-9.12
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1004-kvm - 5.4.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1005-aws - 5.4.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1006-azure - 5.4.0-1006.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1005-gcp - 5.4.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1005-oracle - 5.4.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1004-raspi2 - 5.4.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.6.0-1007-oem - 5.4.0-1002.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-9.12').
linux-kvm package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1004.4').
